SOPHIE ALDRED Companion

AFTERLIFE (004) Page 1
PART ONE — AFTER HEX SCENE 1: INT. TARDIS, CONSOLE ROOM
FX: TVM TARDIS B/G
(FX: OPERATING DOOR CONTROL) (SUBDUED) There. Private Morgan and Captain Aristedes. Back in their own time. Or near enough. They’re both very resourceful. I’m sure they’1ll cope.
FX: DOORS CLOSE
(STANDING OFF, ACROSS ROOM) That’s it, is it? Game over. Send them home. Simple as that? (TO SELF) Not one iota of human feeling.
(FX: SETTING CONTROLS) I’m not human.
FX: TARDIS DEMATERIALISES
(TO SELF) No. And that’s the problem.
At least you’re talking to me now. (BEAT) Ace? (BEAT) How long is this going to go on for?
(FX: FIDDLING WITH CONTROLS) I’m sorry. It was a very brave thing he did. If it weren’t for- [Mister Hex]
(INTERRUPTING) Don’t say his name! You don’t get to say his name again.
He saved us all.
(COLD) I know. And you knew what we were walking into. You could have stopped it. It should never have come to that.
I tried, Ace. I tried to protect everyone. Things had gone... too far, already.
No kidding.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 2

There was nothing I could have done. The die was cast back in Scutari. Be thankful for the time we had with him. It was... a privilege. (BEAT) We should go... somewhere... Take your mind off things...
(GRITTED TEETH) I don’t want to take my mind off things. In case you’d forgotten, I just watched my friend die back there.
I haven’t forgotten. I let him down. I did my best-
(INTERRUPTING) Well, it wasn’t good enough.
I know... I know. And I’m sorry.
BEAT OF SILENCE
Do you even know what that means?
(SNAPPING) Of course I know what it means. Everyone I’ve ever met. Everyone I’ll ever meet. They’re all dead, Ace. Every last one.
What are you talking about?
Flick a switch, and I can reach a time when every soul that ever set foot inside the TARDIS is long departed...
Or, I could go back and see them. The times when they’re alive. Somewhere, somewhen, they’re all still there. Making tea. Walking the dog. Eating beans on toast. Living and breathing...
Alive and dead. Everybody. All of the time. And none of the time. It’s how it’s always been for me. How it always will be.
All right, so why don’t we, then? What if I said I wanted to go and see him?
(BEAT) We... can’t.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 3
Then what’s the point of what you just said? What’s the point of any of it? Dead is dead.
I know. But I can’t take every loss to heart. I can’t afford £6:,. Or “Lda. Id... (BEAT) 2 just: can” ts
For a bloke with two hearts, that’s pretty heartless.
Please understand, Ace. I’m a Time Lord. It gives me a different perspective...

Yeah? So what’s the view like, all the way up there? (BEAT) Jules had a kite. We used to fly it round Perivale. All the gang: Manisha, Midge, Shreela.. We’d take it up Horsenden Hill. Send it right up to the clouds. We’d all take turns. Didn’t matter who was holding it, it’d just go on its merry way...
We loved that kite. (HARD) But it didn’t give a damn about us.
It was a kite. It doesn’t have feelings.
BEAT OF SILENCE
(FX: SETTING CONTROLS, TENTATIVE) So. Where’s it to be? Think what he’d want... He’d want you to carry on. (BEAT) You both
liked... fast ships. Hyperbikes. The Venusian Grand Prix? Lots of
hands, lots of gears...
(INTERRUPTING) No. Not good enough. He’d want to not be dead. want to go and see him when he’s not dead.
We... can’t do that, Ace. I’m sorry.
(FX: WALKING OVER TO CONSOLE) Then in that case...
If there’s anywhere else you want to go... just tell me. I can
take you-
FX: ACE STARTS PRESSING CONTROLS
I
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 4
(INTERRUPTING) I haven’t finished. We’re not going anywhere.
FX: ACE SLAMS CONTROLS, TARDIS LURCHES
Ace? What are you doing?
(FX: FLICKING SWITCHES) Oh yeah. I don’t know what I’m doing, do I? ‘Cos you never showed me. You never needed me to know. It wasn’t part of the plan!
FX: TARDIS LURCHES AGAIN
(FALLING) Ace! Be careful!
(FX: PULLING LEVERS, OPENING PANEL) But I know more than you think. Watching you all these years... I’ve picked up a trick or two.
FX: TARDIS ENGINES STUTTER
Ace!
(FX: WRENCHING COMPONENT FROM CONSOLE) Fluid links! The TARDIS can’t go anywhere without these.
Put them back. They’re delicate instruments. We could be stranded here forever if you-
(SNATCHING THEM AWAY) Get away from me. Don’t touch me.
I’m truly sorry. If you need more time to mourn... If you want to talk...
(BACKING AWAY) Talk? I’ve finished talking to you. I can’t even look at you. (STALKS OFF) Leave me alone!
Ace! I didn’t mean... (DESPERATE) Ace! What do you want me to do?!
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 5
SCENE 2: INT. TARDIS, CORRIDOR OUTSIDE HEX’S ROOM
FX: RUNNING FOOTSTEPS, ACE PANTING, THEN SLOWS AND STOPS
(BREATHLESS) Here. This is the one.
(FX: TRYING DOOR) Locked. No! He’s erasing him already. Wiping him from the ship. How many times has he done this before, eh? Is he gonna do the same when I’m gone?
FX: BANGING ON LOCKED DOOR
(CALLING) Oi. TARDIS. I know you can hear me. Please, just let me in. Don’t let him do this! Not yet. Please. After all these years. Will you open it... for me?
FX: SOFT CLUNK OF DOOR BEING UNLOCKED
(SOTTO) Thank you. (BEAT) Even you’re more human than him.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 6
SCENE 3: INT. TARDIS, CONSOLE ROOM
FX: TARDIS CONSOLE BEEPS
I know... I know. You’ve let her into his room. It might be for the best...
After all I’ve put you through, old thing... (BEAT) I’m sorry about that too. The other TARDIS...
FX: TARDIS BEEPS, CREAKS
But you always stay with me, don’t you? You know me too well. All these centuries. All these lives. I never really give you much of a choice... But given the choice, I’d hope you’d choose to stay...
FX: TARDIS BEEPS
Humans need... looking after. Ace... sometimes makes it harder than most.
Delayed reaction to severe trauma. She needs... T.L.C. I suppose I could start by restoring her sugar levels... Good for shock...
(DECIDING) I know just the thing! (LEAVING CONTROL ROOM) Now where did I put the kitchen...?
FX: FOOTSTEPS GOING OFF
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 7
SCENE 4: INT. TARDIS, HEX’S ROOM (CONTINUOUS)
FX: ACE OPENING AND CLOSING CUPBOARDS, SORTING CLOTHES
(SIGHING) Typical bloke... A mess.
FX: PICKING UP MORE CLOTHES

I’ve got to do this. Can’t just let him seal it up. Chuck everything that’s left of you out into the vortex. We should sort your stuff out... put it away... Keep it somewhere. In case... Just, in case.
I need... a case.. A box... Here... under the bed.
FX: PULLS CASE FROM UNDER BED
Ha. You didn’t believe in folding, did you? Me neither.
FX: HOLDS UP COAT
I remember this jacket. You were wearing it when you came off shift at St Garts.. (BREATHES IT IN) I’m so sorry, mate.
(SAGS ONTO BED) I... don’t know what to do. He has to learn. He has to know... about consequences. Not the big universe stuff. The little people. You and me... He has to see...
FX: CRUMPLING PAPER IN JACKET
What’s that?
FX: TAKES LETTER FROM POCKET
To.. Hilda Schofield. Fifty-three Gerrard Street. New Hoylake, Liverpool...
FX: OPENS ENVELOPE, TAKES OUT LETTER
Look at the date.. It’s old. You’ve had it stashed away for ages... Waiting to land in the right time to catch the post... Maybe you’d forgotten about it?
FX: UNFOLDS LETTER
You don’t mind, do you, mate? I just want to hang on to you. A little bit longer.
CONT
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 8
(FX: SETTLES ON BED) (READING) ‘Dear nan. Sorry I haven’t written before...’

(V/O, OVER ACE) Dear nan. Sorry I haven’t written before. Had to head off in a bit of a rush. It wasn’t exactly planned. Anyway. I’m off. On me travels. Sort of a gap year. Like the posh uni kids do. Round the world. And further... Yeah... I can’t really say where. Let’s leave that one for now.

I got recruited. Nothing dodgy, don’t worry. Me new... mates, I guess. They’re like... troubleshooters. Dropping into places where people need help. Sorting things out. And heading off into the sunset.

We just got out of somewhere. A warzone. The locals had some trouble with... invaders. They hadn’t been settled that long themselves. Only someone else fancied a go at the place they’d found. And tried to take it off them.
A place called Palanor.
CROSS-FADE TO:
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 9
SCENE 5: INT. CAVES OF PALANOR [FLASHBACK]
(FX: DISTANT BATTLE SOUNDS THROUGH, ACE AND HEX RUNNING DOWN
TUNNEL)
What the hell were those things? They were coming out of the walls! Heck, they were the walls!
Rocks. Living rocks... Kragvar, the Doctor called them. That’s why we had to make sure the locals had their own supply of TNT. In case the Kragvar wouldn’t listen.
And they didn’t. Like talking to a brick wall.
Hah! You’re getting the hang of this ‘quipping in the face of danger’ lark. Hang on. We can slow down. Nearly there.
FX: THEY BOTH SLOW TO WALK
So he told you what to expect, then.

Need to know basis. Let’s face it, you’re the newbie. You’1l get used to it. The colonists were getting the upper hand back there. The Kragvar got an urgent recall back to their ship. Can’t think why...
(STOPPING) The Doctor told us to get to Medical... The signs back there said it was along- (BREAKS OFF) Wait. Hold up.
FX: DISTANT BATTLE STOPS, CHEERING
Sounds like they did it. So. Are we clear? They’re all gone?
I said stop. Don’t move. A muscle.
What is it, McShane? (BEAT, REALISATION) Aww no... There’s one of ‘em behind me isn’t there?
FX: CRACKING ROCKS AS KRAGVAR EMERGES FROM STONE WALL
Would it help if I told you there wasn’t?
FX: ROCK-BEAST ROARS
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 10
Somehow... No. (DUCKS A SWIPE) Whoah!
FX: KRAGVAR CRUNCHES CLUMSILY AFTER HIM, HEX DODGES AROUND IT
That’s it, mate. Distract it. See if you can hold it off fora minute. (FX: RUMMAGING IN RUCKSACK)
(DODGING) Hold it off? What with? I didn’t think to bring a pickaxe.
Pickaxe? Wouldn’t scratch it. Somewhere in here though... (SHOUTING) Oi. Rocky Four! You should have gone with your mates. Back to your ship.
(DUCKING AROUND TO AVOID BLOWS) Hurry up and do whatever it is you’re gonna do, Ace. (DODGING) Right about now would be good.
But as you’ve stayed behind, you can say hello to a friend of mine... Noisy little blighter. Goes by the name of Nitro-9.
Uh-oh... Time to-
Leg it! (FX: THROWS CANISTER)
FX: ACE AND HEX RUN AS KRAGVAR ROARS AND EXPLODES
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 11
SCENE 6: INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE PALANOR MEDBAY [FLASHBACK ]
FX: CRUMBLING MASONRY, BABY CRIES, MUFFLED
(V/O) I’m kind of picking things up as I go along. Like I said, I can’t really tell you too much about the where... or the when. But I’m happy. Pretty scared a lot of the time too. But happy.

Actually, you know what? I think I’m having the time of me life. I get to do what I was trained for. Not just changing bedpans and filling in requisition forms and making sure Mrs Brown gets the chicken and chips and not the lasagne...

Don’t get me wrong, the job at St Garts was really worthwhile. But, London’s.. London, you know? You could spend years there — like Matthias — and still hardly scratch the surface. With this... where I’m going now, what we’re doing... it really feels like I’m making a difference. Every day.
FX: ACE AND HEX CRASHING INTO MEDBAY ANTE-CHAMBER
(RUNNING, PANTING) Told you... there’d be a lot... of running!
(ARRIVING) Hang on, will ya! Oh... my... [God]. Bodies...
Looks like they hid out here. Trying to get to the Medical Bay. To avoid the Kragvar. Didn’t work out too well.
You can say that again... How many? A dozen. Must be more under that rubble. All trapped here when the Kragvar dropped the ceiling on them.
Dead... They’re all dead... Why did he want us to come here? It’s too late...
FX: SCRABBLING THROUGH RUBBLE
Wait. There’s something.
FX: BABY CRIES, MUFFLED
Help me Ace. Come here little fella.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 12
(FX: MORE SHIFTING DEBRIS, AND MOVING MOTHER. BABY’S CRIES
CLEARER, SHALLOW LABOURED BREATHING OF MOTHER)
(PICKING UP BABY) Here. He was under his mum. Hang on... she’s still alive too!
She must have shielded him from the rocks. How’s she doing?
Not good. Here. Hold the baby, Ace. Gimme that torch. (PASSES
Here you go. (FX: BABY SQUAWKS) Yeah. I know how you feel, mate. It’s that kind of day...
(EXAMINING WOMAN) Still warm. Pupils... Responsive. Breathing... just about. Why’s she not breathing properly?
(LOOKING IN MOUTH) Airway’s clear...
Shouldn’t you be doing your kiss of life stuff?
(WORKING IT OUT) Maybe... but look. She was protecting him. Must’ve got smashed up pretty badly by those rock-monsters. Looks like she got hit across here...
Compressions? That’s right isn’t it? Mouth to mouth to get her breathing properly again?
No.. wait. It’s only one side...
You what?

Her ribs are only moving up and down on one side... (REALISATION) Get into the medbay, McShane. Her lung’s collapsed! That’s why she’s struggling. Search the cupboards. Find me a tube. A needle. Something sterile.
On it, Nurse. (FX: BABY CRIES AS ACE CARRIES IT OFF, SCRAMBLING
RUBBLE) And you can keep quiet too.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 13
(V/O) They teach you all sorts at med school. Funny how it all disappears out of your head when it comes down to it. Except for the bits you actually need. You focus. And everything becomes clear.
The baby’s mum had been crushed by falling rocks. Pneumothorax. I’d never actually seen one before. But I knew what to do. In theory.
FX: HEX WORKING ON MOTHER, BABY GRIZZLING
Get me some more light.
FX: MOVING TORCH
Ooh. I like it when you’re all masterful.
Don’t joke McShane. This woman’s dying here.
No she’s not. You’re gonna save her.
FX: WOMAN DRAWS WHEEZING, LABOURED BREATHS
That’s it.. You’re doing it yourself now. (BEAT) How’s the baby doing?
FX: BABY GRIZZLES
Dunno really, it’s hard to tell. Here little fella. Look at
that. My mate’s just saved your mum.
MUSIC SEGUE:
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 14
SCENE 7: INT. TARDIS, CORRIDOR OUTSIDE HEX’S ROOM
FX: FOOTSTEPS, DOCTOR CARRYING TRAY WITH RATTLING PLATES
Ace? (STOPPING) Are you still there?
FX: ACE INSIDE ROOM THROWING THINGS INTO CASE
FX: DOCTOR KNOCKS GENTLY
(CALLING AT DOOR) I brought pancakes. Golden syrup. Whipped
cream. Ice cream. Plates and spoons.
(FX: SOUNDS IN ROOM STOP, FOOTSTEPS TOWARDS DOOR INSIDE, BEAT OF SILENCE)
I’1l put them down outside the door.
FX: DOCTOR PUTS DOWN TRAY OF PLATES AND CUTLERY
Or if you like I can bring them- [in]
(FX: TRYING DOOR, IT’S LOCKED) Locked. (BEAT) (CALLING) I can wait here as long as it takes. (SOTTO) Just me and the cutlery. Until you need us.
(FX: PICKS UP SPOONS, GIVES THEM A TENTATIVE RATTLE. BEAT, THEN
SPOONS, GAINING PACE. A MANIC TEMPO... THEN SLOWS TO MORE
BEATS, FINALLY GIVING UP)
BEAT OF SILENCE
(SOTTO) ‘The rest is silence’. Nothing. Not a word. Not even to tell me to be quiet.
(ALOUD) It’s like I said, Ace. Everyone’s dead. All of them. Hex... Evelyn... Mel... Strange business, time. (BEAT) Even you, Ace.
There’s a time and a place when everyone dies. And there are times when they’re very much alive.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 15
SCENE 8: INT. TARDIS, HEX’S ROOM (CONTINUOUS)
(MUFFLED, FROM OTHER SIDE OF DOOR) That’s what’s important. What they did. What they’re doing now. Out there. Happy times and places.
Everyone has their allotted span. The hands keep moving on the clock that counts your lifetime. I can’t stop that, whatever you think. All of them die in the end...
But not all of them die because of you.
(MUFFLED) Ace? What did you say? It’d be easier to talk if you-
(FX: UNDER PREVIOUS, ACE GOES TO DOOR, UNLOCKS AND OPENS IT A CRACK)
-opened the door.
I said. Not all of them die because of you.
Every action has consequences. Ripples. Repercussions. You could say they all lived because of me.
All that time. All those years I stuck up for you. Lysandra was right. The little people don’t matter in your grand schemes.
Oh Ace... What’s the good of ‘grand schemes’ if they don’t help the ‘little’ people? Why do you think I do... what I do.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 16
SCENE 9: INT. TARDIS, CORRIDOR OUTSIDE HEX’S ROOM
CONTINUOUS
I wanted you all to see that. Be a part of it. I want to give you the chance to be extraordinary. All of you. Offer you the opportunity to be the very best you can be.
(BEAT) You stalled the TARDIS at the edge of the Milky Way. I was enjoying the view. Andromeda one way, Triangulum the other.

Each star that shines out there... we’re seeing it back through time. It could be dead. Could have been cold for millennia. Or it could be blazing away right this instant. Either way, you can still see its light. That’s the point.
And Ace. You’ve shone so very, very brightly...
This isn’t about me. It’s about... him.
Everything he did. That can’t be undone. All the lives he touched. All the lives he saved.
(SMALL) But he’s gone. And it hurts.

(GENTLY) If you need me to... If you can’t stand it, Ace.. I can make it go away. All the pain. All the hurt. We can carry on. Or even start all over. Begin again. Let me help you... (BEAT, SOFT) Contact...
ANGRY) Get away from me. Stay out of my head! (BEAT, RUEFUL
Oh, Professor. You nearly had me then. No. You don’t get away with it that easily.
FX: SLAMS DOOR, SCATTERS PLATES
(FX: POUNDS ON DOOR, DESPERATE) I’m sorry. I’m sorry. How many times do I have to say it before you listen? I’m sorry!
BEAT
FX: ACE OPENS DOOR AGAIN
Just once. You only have to say it once. But you have to know what it means.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 17
I know Ace. Believe me, I know. (BEAT) Do you want to leave? Is that it? (BEAT) I could let you out at the next world... Whatever time, whatever place you wish.
No. Course I don’t want to leave. I don’t know what you’ll do.
Oh, I’ll be fine. I always am.
It’s not you I’m worried about. I don’t know what you’1l do... to the next one.
Ace...
You’ve screwed up any chance I had at being normal. (SOTTO) Poor old Henry Noone found that out.
(TO DOCTOR) It wasn’t Audrey. It wasn’t Fenric. It was you. You messed up my life. By turning it into a game.
I’ve only ever had your best interests at heart.
Then thanks for nothing. All that. For what? You lost. Worse than that. You weren’t even a piece on the board. He was. A pawn to be sacrificed.
I didn’t know. I got it all so wrong... How could I have got it so wrong?
You’re not who you thought you were. You’re not who I thought you were. What was it you called me once? An emotional cripple?
That was for show. It’s not what I think.
CONT
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 18

Doesn’t mean it’s not true. Doesn’t mean it’s not what you’ve made me. Look at me! I don’t even know how old I am any more. I mean, pancakes? I’m not ten! I don’t know how to behave like a... like a person. I tried. To grow up. But it’s more than just changing your name, changing your clothes. It always comes back to this. The Professor and Ace. That’s what I am, because you’1ll never let me be anything else.
Ace...
But then he came along. He looked up to me. For the first time, I thought it could be different...
Dorothy...
But I can’t function anywhere except here. I can’t live with normal people. I can’t live with anyone. Except you. (BEAT) I had no-one. No family. No-one who cared. Until you...
Audrey cared, Ace.
I know that now. And I’d have been better off with her... But you had to... (BEAT) I loved you, Doctor! And now I... I...
Please...
You’re not a god. You’re just a lonely little man. Playing god.
I don’t...
Shut up.
Please. Can’t we just...
Go away, Professor. (BEAT) Doctor. Leave me alone.
But Ace...
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 19
COLD) I said. Leave me alone. (FX: SLAMS DOOR IN HIS FACE
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 20
SCENE 10: EXT. PALANOR SURFACE [FLASHBACK]
(V/O) There’s this bloke. He’s in charge. He’s called the Doctor. And he’s got a knack of being in the right place at the right time. Or the wrong time if you’re on the wrong side.
And we’re like his... helpers. This girl, McShane. Ace. And me. It’s nice to be trusted to get on with it. To do the right
thing. And it’s funny. I want him to be proud of me. Because being with him, it means something.
Although... we seem to spend a lot of the time waiting around for him to explain things. But he usually does. Eventually.
FX: COLONIST ACTIVITY, REPAIRING, BUILDING, OFF
He’s coming.
FX: TARDIS MATERIALISES
Right on time. Never lets us down. Although... would it have killed him to tell us what he was up to?
FX: TARDIS DOORS OPEN
You get used to it.
(EMERGING) Hello you two. Ace, would you mind fetching our micro-generator for the good people of Palanor. Help them kick- start their own power supply. It’s over in the TARDIS garage.
Fetching and carrying... Again. All right. Back in a mo. (FX:
TARDIS)
Thank you. Now, young man. All ready for the off?
What happened up there? The Kragvar ship?
You saw the hailstorm?
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 21
That was them? You blew them up? Whoah. That’s pretty hardcore.
I’m not without mercy. I give everyone a chance to prove themselves. To be better than they are. Not everyone takes it. So ‘hardcore’ is all that’s left of them.
Judge, jury and executioner, eh? Even so.
They had every opportunity to change. To co-exist. But the Kragvar threatened to crush every last mammal on the planet. That was their choice. I couldn’t let that happen.
Yeah, would’ve ruined my day.
You do understand, Mister Schofield? I don’t do this lightly. Every life has a weight. An effect. I try to tilt the balance towards the positive. (BEAT) How’s the baby? And his mother?
It was touch and go for a while there. But she’ll be fine. They both will.
FX: ACE DRAGS GENERATOR OUT OF TARDIS
One micro-generator. (BEAT) I’1l just drag it all the way over there then, shall I?
Thank you, Ace. That would be very helpful.
FX: ACE DRAGS GENERATOR OFF

(TO HEX) You see, with her to look after him, that small boy could grow up to be a great leader. The inspiration this colony needs to do great things. Palanor is destined to be an influential power in these parts. A force for good.
You should understand our actions have effects far beyond the immediate.
I just saw someone who needed help. And I helped them.
FX: ACE WALKING BACK OVER
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 22
Of course. And that’s why I’m pleased you decided to join us.
Keep doing what you’re good at, Nurse. Leave me to worry about
the bigger picture.
A dirty job, but somebody’s gotta do it.. Come on face-ache.
GOES BACK IN TARDIS
Why, though? Why you, Doctor?
Who else do you see? Come along. Time to go. (ENTERS TARDIS)
(FOLLOWING INTO TARDIS) Hang on... How did you even know about the baby? You just got here...
FX: TARDIS DOORS CLOSE, DEMATERIALISATION
(V/O) So, we did some good. Helped them get set up. Saw off the
bullies. And went on to save the next place.
AFTERLIFE (004) Page 23
SCENE 11: INT. TARDIS, HEX’S ROOM (CONTINUOUS)
FX: LETTER PAGE TURNING
(V/O) All in a day’s work for a Schofield, eh?
But it means so much more than that. I’ve found some proper mates. People who make me feel like I’m making a difference. That’s what you wanted, nan. I hope I’m making you proud.
You were good at what you did. She’d be proud. I know she would be.
(V/O) So that’s it. That’s what I’m up to. Like I said, still early days. Dunno how long I’m gonna stick with it. But I’m enjoying it for now.
And I promise, if I get a chance, if I’m ever in town, I’11l pop over for a cuppa and some of your fruitcake. All the places we've been, no-one makes a raisin sponge to touch yours, nan.
Gotta go. Another dictatorship needs overthrowing. And I might even be on the news this time. I mean, me? Being interviewed on the news? Mad, innit?
